title: I'm close, I think..
content:
I’ve seen the typeface used in a couple other places, and came across it again here :

[http://shinymedia.blogs.com/photos/uncategorized/dc\_new\_zealand.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181033/http:/shinymedia.blogs.com/photos/uncategorized/dc_new_zealand.jpg "http://shinymedia.blogs.com/photos/uncategorized/dc\_new\_zealand.jpg")

It’s definately not Eurostile. The closest I could come up with was LTC’s Octic Gothic Two ( [http://www.p22.com/lanston/octicgothic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181033/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/octicgothic.html "http://www.p22.com/lanston/octicgothic.html") ), but the R, S and others are different.

It’s been bugging me for quite a while.

Anyone else willing to take a stab?

 [‹ Looking for this Roger Dean "Yes" font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181033/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43630 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bike Month NYC 2008 rounded tech sans - Naiv {James Langdon} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181033/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48119 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jsugiura
